summary: The Qualified Immunity Act of 2025 seeks to codify the defense of qualified immunity for law enforcement officers in actions brought under 42 U.S.C. § 1983. It stipulates that an officer is not liable if the right violated wasn't clearly established or if a court previously ruled the conduct lawful. The bill defines “law enforcement officer” and “law enforcement agency,” and states that if the officer is not found liable, the employing agency also isn't liable. The amendments take effect 180 days after enactment.
